oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hermitage
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Front view of the Hermitage house and landscape. The yard surronding the house shows a bicycle, a fenced in area, and a horse.
The Hermitage, home of President Andrew Jackson, is a Greek Revival mansion built in 1819, enlarged in 1831, and rebuilt after an 1834 fire, furnished largely with pieces owned by Jackson.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Calvert, Peter Ross, 1855-1931; Calvert, Ebenezer, 1850-1924
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Calvert Brothers Studio Glass Plate Negatives
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mansions; Residences; Architecture, Domestic; Greek revival (Architecture); Historic buildings
Houses; Historic sites
